content: About a month ago I was talking about scheduling a kickoff meeting
I think we've had enough time brainstorming. There have been some private discussions amongst the wg leads about how to schedule a meeting
but I think we should push to do the rest of the scheduling in the open
@njn @Wesley Wiser I think you two were saying 8pm EDT (= 10am AEST) would work for both of you?
@Santiago Pastorino do you have thoughts on the above? Or anyone else in ... hmm, is there a way I can mention everyone subscribed to this stream ...?
I think you want @all
that sounds scary
is that stream-sensitive?
That's what the autocomplete claims lol
But yes, 8pm EDT would work great for me
ah I think @stream is an alias for @all, according to zulip#8930

pnkfelix said:

njn Wesley Wiser I think you two were saying 8pm EDT (= 10am AEST) would work for both of you?

this question is really directed at everyone in @stream
note that I haven't specified a day of the week here.
this is everyone's chance to say "that time would work, except for this day of the week"
(and if I'm given the opportunity, I'll try to nudge it away from Fridays. I don't like giving up my Friday evenings.)
Okay I think this works for me. EDT is UTC-4, right? Then I think it'll be 8pm for me as well, and that works rather well for me :)
Any day except Fridays if possible
that's 9pm my time if EDT is UTC-4, :+1: from me except fridays too
in general it would be very complicated for me to attend to meetings at this time, but I can make it to the kickoff I think

Félix Fischer said:

Okay I think this works for me. EDT is UTC-4, right? Then I think it'll be 8pm for me as well, and that works rather well for me :)

I think you can use this service to get an authorative answer to your Q: https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/converter.html?iso=20200806T000000&p1=263&p2=22
One of the topics at the kickoff should definitely be how we can avoid having the meetings always be in the evenings for those in EDT
(options for this include 1. alternating the meeting time each week, or 2. having more than one meeting per week, and expecting much <100% attendance at any given meeting.)
I think we should also record meetings
(FYI, there’s a <time command in Zulip for sending times that convert to the local time zone)
8pm EDT is 1am here (if my conversion is right), so I won’t be able to make that time. Any day of the week works otherwise.
testing <time command, if the meeting was tomorrow it will be at: 2020-07-29T21:00:00-03:00
Oh, interesting. That's 9pm for me
Well, according to mobile Zulip
That works, as long as it's a weekday in Melbourne (i.e. not Friday in the US)

I said:

Oh, interesting. That's 9pm for me

But the command actually displayed Santiago's time :laughing:
So I think I just got confused. The proposed time is 8pm my time
The Zulip mobile client tends to lag a bit behind the site in terms of features.

Félix Fischer said:

I said:

Oh, interesting. That's 9pm for me

But the command actually displayed Santiago's time :laughing:
So I think I just got confused. The proposed time is 8pm my time

/me is now confused. Is it that <time uses the time zone of the sender ?

When you write <time you get a datetime picker and you pick the time in your timezone. What's supposed to happen is that when others see your message, the <time is rendered in their local timezone. But that doesn't seem to happen on the mobile client.
oh now I see
Okay well I'm officially proposing 8pm EDT on Tuesday of next week, aka 2020-08-04T20:00:00-04:00
let me see if I can create an event on the compiler team calendar for it
I’ll do my best to try attend or catch up the following morning.
@davidtwco don't worry.I'll make sure one of the agenda items is to ensure we do something to have some kind of (hopefully synchronous) meeting that is more accommodating for people in ~EU time zones
@pnkfelix are we doing zoom? do you have the ability to record the meeting so others can watch it?
oh that's an excellent point
I believe I can host a zoom meeting.
oKay it should be set up. Meeting ID: 952 6075 4354 aka https://mozilla.zoom.us/j/95260754354 . There is a password; it is 382382 (I added this in after sending, so it won't be in the zulip archive)
and I likewise put a link into the event on the compiler team calendar, in the "location" field.
Just to confirm: next Tuesday, at 8pm EDT, right?
@Félix Fischer kickoff is tomorrow (Tuesday) at 8pm EDT
:ok:🏻
by the way, the meeting is still planned to run as scheduled. However, there is a Tornado Watch in effect for my area at the same time as the meeting
so if I'm not there,, either start without me or reschedule (i'll leave it up to the other leads to make a decision there at the start of the meeting; hopefully deciding this won't be necessary)

pnkfelix said:

by the way, the meeting is still planned to run as scheduled. However, there is a Tornado Watch in effect for my area at the same time as the meeting

in this case, what I think I'd prefer to do is to re-schedule right now
in my case is worse to arrive to the meeting time, set some things aside and be ready and then cancel it
I think most of the people were fine with the meeting being any day but on friday
cc @Wesley Wiser @njn @Félix Fischer @davidtwco opinions?
btw, it seems like we need @WG-incr-comp or something :)
Yas to that last bit, why not?
I don’t have a strong preference as to whether the meeting takes place, but I would prefer to know in case I end up inclined to stay up later to attend.

davidtwco said:

I don’t have a strong preference as to whether the meeting takes place, but I would prefer to know in case I end up inclined to stay up later to attend.

right, kind of the same happens to me :), if I'm around that late I'd prefer to be sure we have the meeting

And to postponing: I mean, I was getting hyped up and all that, but I'm in a position (waiting for thesis application to be accepted) where my time is quite flexible, so I can reschedule no prob.
Also, the weather is out of our control. I hope you guys are safe out there <3
another thing is that if @pnkfelix is not around, the meeting won't be recorded for the rest that are unable to attend
I would also prefer to reschedule if pnkfelix can't make it.
ok, it seems we are more or less all in the same situation, so I'd propose to re-schedule the meeting for tomorrow same time react with :+1: if agree and with :-1: if you disagree
hmm okay let me at least check that that time works for me
(because, you know, if the goal is to ensure I'm there...)
the other problem is that @njn is probably asleep right now
yep I was going to mention that, I guess they'll be around in some hours
maybe let's cancel today and try to re-schedule it for as soon as we can?
but I guess that the meeting time is 10am at @njn's local time
so at least they won't be waking up early (hopefully) only to discover that the meeting is rescheduled
yep or 9am
I think it's 10am @njn's time yeah
Okay i can do same time tomorrow
I’ll change compiler team calendar event
Same time tomorrow is fine. (And yes, the meeting is at 10am my time.)
@pnkfelix good luck avoiding tornadoes
(FYI, I've made a @*wg-incr-comp* now)
@*wg-incr-comp* is probably a good idea. I think I had been making do in the meantime with @*stream* in this stream; but a more specific name that is not context-sensitive is probably much better.

pnkfelix said:

@*wg-incr-comp* is probably a good idea. I think I had been making do in the meantime with @*stream* in this stream; but a more specific name that is not context-sensitive is probably much better.

yesterday I was going to use @*stream* and was afraid of notifying 55 members of the stream, so I ended pinging you one by one :)
The meeting is right now right?

Félix Fischer said:

The meeting is right now right?

right now, we are just starting
Are we doing zoom in the end? I thought there was a link, but a quick search didn't find it
password is 382382
awesome
omw
An old blog post: https://blog.rust-lang.org/2016/09/08/incremental.html
@pnkfelix thank you for chairing and minuting!
Yeah that minuting looked pretty great :D
